uk.gov.gchq.palisade.mapreduce

Class PalisadeInputFormat<V>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.hadoop.mapreduce.InputFormat<LeafResource,V>
      • uk.gov.gchq.palisade.mapreduce.PalisadeInputFormat<V>
  • Type Parameters:
    V - The value type for the map task

    public class PalisadeInputFormat<V>
extends org.apache.hadoop.mapreduce.InputFormat<LeafResource,V>
    The main client class for using Palisade data inside of the Hadoop framework. Clients should set this class as the input format for a MapReduce job inside their client code.

    • Method Detail

      • getSplits

        public List<org.apache.hadoop.mapreduce.InputSplit> getSplits(org.apache.hadoop.mapreduce.JobContext context)
                                                       throws IOException

        This method will try to split the resource details returned from the Palisade service across multiple input splits as guided by the maxmimum mappers hint. However, we can only honour this hint so far, for example, each separate data request will generate at least one mapper. At the moment we don't try to balance input splits across multiple data requests. This may be added in the future.

        Specified by:
        getSplits in class org.apache.hadoop.mapreduce.InputFormat<LeafResource,V>
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if no data requests have been added with addDataRequest(JobContext, RegisterDataRequest) or if no Palisade service has been set or if the maximum map hint is negative
        IOException
        See Also:
        setMaxMapTasksHint(JobContext, int)

      • setPalisadeService

        public static void setPalisadeService(org.apache.hadoop.mapreduce.JobContext context,
                                      PalisadeService service)
        Set the PalisadeService to be used by a job. This MUST be set by clients before the job launches.
        Parameters:
        context - the job to set the service for
        service - the PalisadeService that requests should be sent to for this job
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if anything is null

        Returns:
        the service or null if none set
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if context is null
        API Note:
        This method should ALWAYS be used instead of accessing the field directly, even internally in this class.

      • addDataRequest

        public static void addDataRequest(org.apache.hadoop.mapreduce.JobContext context,
                                  RegisterDataRequest request)
        Adds a data request for the given job. This is the main method by which clients can request data for a MapReduce job through Palisade. This will be added to the job configuration and used once a job is submitted.
        Parameters:
        context - the job to be configured
        request - the data request to be added
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if anything is null

        Parameters:

        requests - array of requests
        Throws:

        Returns:
        the list data requests currently registered for a job

      • setMaxMapTasksHint

        public static void setMaxMapTasksHint(org.apache.hadoop.mapreduce.JobContext context,
                                      int maxMaps)
        Set a hint for the maximum number of map tasks that the given job should be split into. Note that this is a hint and the system is free to ignore it. There will always be at least one map task per data request generated, however since each request may require multiple $Resources to be processed, this method allows the client to provide a hint at how widely those resouces should be spread across map tasks.
        Parameters:
        context - the job to set the maximum hint for
        maxMaps - the maximum number of mappers desired, a value of 0 implies no limit
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if context is null
        IllegalArgumentException - if maxMaps is negative

      • getMaxMapTasksHint

        public static int getMaxMapTasksHint(org.apache.hadoop.mapreduce.JobContext context)
        Get the maximum number of mappers hint set for a job. A value of zero means no limit has been set.
        Parameters:
        context - the job to retrieve the details for
        Returns:
        the maximum number of map tasks hint
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if context is null

      • setSerialiser

        public static <T> void setSerialiser(org.apache.hadoop.mapreduce.JobContext context,
                                     Serialiser<T> serialiser)
        Sets the Serialiser for a given job. This takes the given serialiser and serialisers that into the configuration for the specified job. This allows the Hadoop RecordReader to create the serialiser inside the MapReduce job for the de-serialisation step before sending the data to the map task. The serialiser will be serialised into JSON and the resulting string stored inside the Hadoop configuration object.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the output type of the Serialiser
        Parameters:
        context - the job to configure
        serialiser - the serialiser that can decode the value type this job is processing

      • setSerialiser

        public static <T> void setSerialiser(org.apache.hadoop.conf.Configuration conf,
                                     Serialiser<T> serialiser)
        Sets the Serialiser for a given configuration. This takes the given serialiser and serialisers that into the configuration. This allows the Hadoop RecordReader to create the serialiser inside the MapReduce job for the de-serialisation step before sending the data to the map task. The serialiser will be serialised into JSON and the resulting string stored inside the Hadoop configuration object.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the object type of the Serialiser
        Parameters:
        conf - the job to configure
        serialiser - the serialiser that can decode the value type this job is processing
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - for null parameters

      • getSerialiser

        public static <V> Serialiser<V> getSerialiser(org.apache.hadoop.mapreduce.JobContext context)
                                       throws IOException
        Creates the de-serialiser from the information stored in a given job context. This uses a JSON serialiser to create the serialiser from data stored.
        Type Parameters:
        V - the value type of the serialiser
        Parameters:
        context - the job
        Returns:
        the serialiser from this configuration
        Throws:
        IOException - if de-serialisation could not happen
        NullPointerException - if anything is null

      • setResourceErrorBehaviour

                                             ReaderFailureMode mode)
        Sets how the job should respond to errors in reading a resource through Palisade.
        Parameters:
        context - the job to configure
        mode - the desired failure mode
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if anything is null
        See Also:

      • getResourceErrorBehaviour

        public static ReaderFailureMode getResourceErrorBehaviour(org.apache.hadoop.mapreduce.JobContext context)
        Gets how the job has been set to respond to resource connection errors. The default behaviour is ReaderFailureMode.CONTINUE_ON_READ_FAILURE.
        Parameters:
        context - the job to query
        Returns:
        the failure mode
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if anything is null

      • getSerialiser

        public static <V> Serialiser<V> getSerialiser(org.apache.hadoop.conf.Configuration conf)
                                       throws IOException
        Creates the de-serialiser from the information stored in a given configuration. This uses a JSON serialiser to create the serialiser from data stored.
        Type Parameters:
        V - the value type of the serialiser
        Parameters:
        conf - the configuration object for a job
        Returns:
        the serialiser from this configuration
        Throws:
        IOException - if de-serialisation could not happen
        NullPointerException - if parameter is null
